availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Clark (Williamson County, Tennessee, trader and famer.)

body.p: Williamson County, Tennessee, farmer and agent. North Carolina native. Married to Mary Poindexter Clark. Father of George Clark, Joseph Clark, Francis Clark, Mary A. Clark, John Clark, William Thomas Clark, and Watson G. Clark. Trader in Marshall County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Williamson County, Tennessee, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Williamson County in 1860. Agent of the State of Tennessee for the requisition of John W. Scales in October 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, District 8, p. 60B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Williamson County, Eastern Subdivision, p. 247.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Eastern Subdivision.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 10668.
Tennessee Death Records, 1908-1958, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Rutherford County Death Certificates, File 4276.
